【考】complicate；complicated; uncomplicated

【派】judiciously  adv.  明断地；明智而审慎地
【考】judicious；judiciousness

justification.value: n. 正当理由；合理的解释： an acceptable reason or explanation for it.

legitimate.value:
v. 使合法： to legitimize
adj. 合法的：within, allowed by, or sanctioned by the law
adj. 合理的：based on logical reasoning; reasonable

mercenary.value: adj. 唯利是图的：motivated solely by a desire for monetary or material gain

methodical.value:
adj. 有板有眼的；有条不紊的；井然有序的：arranged or proceeding in regular, systematic order
【考】methodical；methodically

mysterious.value: adj. 神秘的，难解的：difficult to explain or understand

nebulous.value:
adj. 模糊不清的：lacking definite form or limits; vague
【注】该词实际来自天文阅读中经常考的：nebula 星云。

neglect.value:
v. 不注意，忽略：to pay little or no attention to; fail to heed; disregard
v. 不予重视；忽视：to fail to care for or attend to properly
v. 疏忽；疏漏：to fail to do or carry out, as through carelessness or oversight
【考】neglect ；neglects；neglected

obfuscate.value:
v. 混淆，使混乱，使困惑：to make so confused or opaque as to be difficult to perceive or understand.
v. 使模糊；使变暗：to render indistinct or dim; darken
【派】obfuscation  n. 模糊，混乱
【考】obfuscate；obfuscating；obfuscation

permanent.value:
adj. 永久的，不变的：not expected to change in status, condition, or place
adj. 永久的，永恒的： lasting or remaining without essential change
【考】permanent；permanently

pragmatic.value:
adj. 讲求实效的；实用的；务实的：dealing or concerned with facts or actual occurrences; practical
【注】该词在考试中经常和idealistic相对。

praise.value:
v. 赞扬，称赞：to express warm approbation of, commendation for, or admiration for
n. 赞扬，表扬，称赞：expression of approval, commendation, or admiration

quixotic.value:
adj. 幻想的；不切实际的；空想的：caught up in the pursuit of unreachable goals; idealistic without regard to practicality
adj. 多变的；易冲动的：capricious; impulsive; unpredictable

relevant.value: adj. 相关的；相应的；有重要性的：having significant and demonstrable bearing on the matter at hand

remedy.value:
n. 补救方法；解决方法，解决良方：something that corrects an evil, a fault, or an error
n. 药品；治疗方法：a medicine, application, or treatment that relieves or cures a disease
v. 纠正；补救；矫正：to set right; remove, rectify, or counteract

restore.value:
v. 恢复：to bring back into existence or use; reestablish
v. 使恢复，使康复，使复原：to bring back to an original condition
v. 归还，交还，返还：to make restitution of; give back
【派】restoration  n. 恢复；修复
【考】restore；restorative

resurgence.value: n. 重新兴起，复苏：a restoration to use, acceptance, activity, or vigor; a revival

ridicule.value:
v. 嘲笑，愚弄：words or actions intended to evoke contemptuous laughter at or feelings toward a person or thing
【考】ridicule ；ridiculed

sage.value:
adj. 贤明的，睿智的，博学多识的：proceeding from or marked by wisdom and calm judgment
n. 哲人；智者；圣人：one venerated for experience, judgment, and wisdom
【派】sagacious   adj. 聪慧的，睿智的
【考】sage；sagacious

salient.value:
adj. 极度显眼的，显著的：strikingly conspicuous; prominent
【注】salience  n. 显著，突出； sapient  adj. 聪明的，有洞察力的
【考】salient；salience

scrutinize.value:
v. 详细检查，细查：to examine or observe with great care; inspect critically
【考】scrutinize；scrutinized

speculation.value: n. 推测；猜测；猜想：reasoning based on inconclusive evidence; conjecture or supposition

spurious.value:
adj. 伪造的，假的：lacking authenticity or validity in essence or origin; not genuine; false
adj.（论点、推理）不正确的，站不住脚的：a spurious argument or way of reasoning is incorrect, and so the conclusion is probably incorrect

supplant.value:
v. 替代，取代：to usurp the place of, especially through intrigue or underhanded tactics
【考】supplant；supplanted

supplement.value:
v. 补充，增补：to add or serve as a supplement to
【考】supplement；supplementary

surpass.value:
v. 超过，胜过，优于：to become better, greater, or stronger than : exceed
v. 超出（范围）：to be beyond the limit, powers, or capacity of; transcend
【考】surpass；surpassed；unsurpassed

sycophantic.value: adj. 阿谀奉承的;谄媚的;拍马屁的：of, relating to, or characteristic of a sycophant : fawning, obsequious

synthesis.value:
n. 综合，结合：the combining of separate elements or substances to form a coherent whole
n.（通过化学或生物反应进行的）合成：the synthesis of a substance is the production of it by means of chemical or biological reactions

unreliable.value: adj. 不可靠的；不能信赖的：marked by or exhibiting a lack of reliability

accelerate.value:
v. 使增速：to increase the speed of
v. 促进；加快：to cause to develop or progress more quickly
【考】accelerate；accelerated；accelerating

acute.value:
adj. 急性的（发作快且持续时间短但发病过程剧烈的）： having a rapid onset and following a short but severe course
adj. 敏锐的：keenly perceptive or discerning; penetrating
adj. 紧急的：seriously demanding urgent attention

affable.value: adj. 和蔼可亲，易于与人交谈的：being friendly, amiable and at ease in talking to others

affirm.value:
v. 断言；肯定，确认：to assert (as a judgment or decree) as valid or confirmed
【考】affirms；affirmed；affirming

aggrandize.value:
v. 增加：to make great or greater : increase, enlarge
【考】aggrandize；aggrandized ；aggrandizing

allusive.value:
adj. 暗指的，不直接的：an implied or indirect reference especially in literature also : the use of such references
【派】allusion  n. 暗示；间接提到：the act of alluding; indirect reference
【注】在GRE填空中，该词经常会和literal和figurative等词一起。literal表示的是直接的，没有比喻的（avoiding exaggeration, metaphor）,而allusive和figurative都是不直接的表达，具体请读者参考后面的literal和figurative。
【考】allusive；allusion；allusions

alternative.value:
n. 代替物，代替选择：if one thing is an alternative to another, the first can be found, used, or done instead of the second
n. 另一选择（这些可能性中的一种）：either of these possibilities: choice
adj. 非传统的，新颖的：different from the usual or conventional
adj. 其他的：an alternative plan or offer is different from the one that you already have, and can be done or used instead
【考】alternative；alternatives

authentic.value:
adj. 非伪造的，真正的：having a claimed and verifiable origin or authorship; not counterfeit or copied
adj. 可信的，真实的：worthy of acceptance or belief as conforming to or based on fact

autonomy.value:
n.自治：the quality or state of being self-governing
n. 自主决定权：the ability or opportunity to make your own decisions without being controlled by anyone else
【考】autonomous

banal.value: adj. 平庸的，陈腐的；平淡无奇的：lacking originality, freshness, or novelty; drearily commonplace and often predictable; trite

bias.value:
n. 偏见: an inclination of temperament or outlook especially : a personal and sometimes unreasoned judgment
v. 使有偏见；使偏向: to influence in a particular, typically unfair direction; prejudice
【注】例句1句中的construction意为：对一个措辞或陈述所做出的阐明或解释。具体参见construction一词。

compliment.value:
n. 赞美；恭维(话)：an expression of praise, admiration, or congratulation
v. 称赞；恭维：to say something nice to someone in order to praise them
【考】complimented；complimentary

concrete.value:
adj. 具体的，实在的： characterized by or belonging to immediate experience of actual things or events 
n. 混凝土： a hard strong building material

condescension.value:
n. 傲慢；屈尊；俯就：patronizing attitude or behavior; voluntary descent from one's rank or dignity in relations with an inferior 
【派】condescending  adj. 盛气凌人的;居高临下的
【注】该词在填空中出现的频率非常高。
【考】condescension；condescending

condone.value:
v. 宽恕；谅解；纵容：to overlook, forgive, or disregard (an offense) without protest or censure
【考】condone；condones

consensus.value: n. 一致看法；共识：an opinion or position reached by a group as a whole

conservative.value:
adj.保守的；反对变革的： favoring traditional views and values; tending to oppose change
adj. 传统的，守旧的：traditional or restrained in style
adj. （估计或猜猜）保守的，稳妥的，谨慎小心的：(having or showing a close attentiveness to avoid danger or trouble
【派】conservation  n. 保护，节约
【考】conservation；conservatism

copious.value:
adj. 丰富的，供应充足的： yielding or containing plenty; affording ample supply
adj. 大量的；充足的： large in quantity; abundant
adj. 冗长的，啰嗦的： abounding in matter, thoughts, or words; wordy

culmination.value: n. 终点;高潮；顶点： something, especially something important, that is the culmination of an activity, process, or series of events happens at the end of it

cursory.value:
adj. 仓促的；匆匆的；粗略的： performed with haste and scant attention to detail
【例】I gave the letter a fairly cursory reading. 我大略地读了一下那封信。

decry.value:
v. 公开谴责: to condemn openly
【考】decry；decried

defend.value:
v. 支持，捍卫: to maintain or support in the face of argument or hostile criticism
v. 保护，保卫: to make or keep safe from danger, attack, or harm
v. 保住，守住:to retain or seek to retain (as a title or position) against a challenge in a contest 
【考】defend；defended

defy.value:
v. 反抗，违抗：to oppose or resist with boldness and assurance
v. 不服从，不合作：to oppose or resist with boldness and assurance
【考】defy；defied

delay.value:
n. 耽搁, 迟滞：the condition of being delayed; detainment
v. 使延误；使耽搁：to cause to be later or slower than expected or desired

v. 否认，驳斥：to declare untrue; contradict

discretion.value:

n. 自行决定的自由；酌情决定权：freedom to act or judge on one's own
【派】discretionary  adj. 自由决定的，自由支配的
